core_team.name: Dr Lakshmi
core_team.details:
Dr. Lakshmi Haobam, a PhD degree in Psychology from Panjab University. She specialises in Clinical Patterns and Therapies, Clinical Psycho Diagnostics and Basic Counselling.

She has 7+ years of experience in counseling - relationship issues, internal conflicts, past unresolved issues, general stress, interpersonal stressful dynamics with friends, etc.

A compassionate person who goes out of way to help people. She has been actively involved with NGOs too.

She is also trained in conducting JPMR, a muscle relaxation technique which help to get a good sleep at night.

core_team.name: Mrs Pallabita
core_team.details:
Mrs. Pallabita Barooah Chowdhury is a double Masters in Education and Psychology from the Gauhati University. A trained and qualified teacher with 20+ years of experience - mentored, guided and counselled students at various educational institutions.

She is passionate about helping people in distress to come out better. She approaches counseling from an eclectic and integrated perspective and defines herself as a Life Coach to students.

A spiritualist at heart who believes in Positive Thought, Feeling and Action as medium of life defining changes and transitions.

A passionate Educator and Mentor and co-author of ‘A Handbook on Parenting’.

core_team.name: Dr Bandana
core_team.details:
Dr. Bandana Dutta, a PhD in Psychology from Centre for Advanced Study, Utkal University. She has 33+ years of experience as a psychologist.

She uses the Projective Techniques to assess her clients and unveils their personality and probes deep into their inner self. She uses client –centered psychotherapy, Cognitive Therapy, Psychodynamic Therapy, Grapho- Therapy, Counselling and Relaxation Techniques to support the client’s in their day- today activities and overall well being. A very compassionate individual with the knack of helping people.

She is an active a member of Assam Autism Foundation and Mind India, Gauhati.

core_team.name: Mr. Rakesh
core_team.details:
Mr Rakesh is a Masters’ in Counseling Psychology from Sampurna­Montfort College, Bangalore.

He specializes in Family therapy, Group therapy and designing personalised de­addiction programs and have worked extensively with the youth towards issues like choice of career, suicidal ideation, conflicted relationships, depression etc.

He has been involved with many educational institutions in the city of Bangalore and Guwahati and has served a number of N.G.O’s that work with individuals facing issues of substance - dependence.

He believes highest and the most charitable act in the world is to listen silently, attentively, when a weary heart is speaking.
